Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2015 02:17PM tgoldens wrote: I'm sure your mother in law is just trying to keep you calm however you are the one feeling the pain/sensations. Not everyone understands. I would call your surgeon and speak with the nurse or Dr. Are you due to go back to the office for follow up and results?. Pls keep me posted. I was diagnosed with a fibroidadenoma and surgeon said no biopsey needed even though I was diagnosed with ADH in right breast

Posts.Content: tgoldens wrote: My question is can a woman develope new ADH or BC even when on meds? Right breast lower outer quadrant. MRI guided biopsy was papilloma. The biopsy from the lumpectomy came back as multifocal ADH. I am taking aromasin(exemestane) for 1 year so far. We are now watching 2 lumps in the upper area of lleft breast. 57 yrs old . Lumpectomy 12/2103 . Started med 4/2014 June 2014 I started having pain in L breast . Tests showed nothing until 12/2014. They were stable per MRI 4/2015 Dx 12/3/2018, LCIS/DCIS, Right, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Surgery Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Multifocal Atypical Ductal Hyperplasia (ADH) tgoldens Ddw79

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2018 04:22PM - edited Dec 6, 2018 04:36PM by tgoldens Hi Everyone, Diagnosis is DCIS in both areas. Saw the surgeon yesterday to go over everything. Will be having mastectomy of both breasts. I had lumpectomy 5 yrs ago for ADH. If I have 2 more lumpectomies the breast will end up looking deformed......pretty much nothing left inside from 6 o'clock to 11 o'clock which is why the nipple sparing mastectomy is being advised. I see plastic surgeon on 12/17/18. When I talk about it I feel like I'm talking about another person.....not talking about me. There were also Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia

Posts.Content: tgoldens wrote: 2013: biopsy in right breast was pappiloma. the lumpectomy biopsy was ADH. I Took aromasin(exemestane) for 18 mos. I had to stop because of memory issues, couldn't concentrate etc. all the other side effects I got thru and they passed(numbness, joint pain) on tamoxifen for 6weeks and omg I now have leg and foot cramps non stop. I stopped the med and will speak with oncologist next week. my question is: has anyone stopped the med and had an ADH recurrence or developed BC. Or has anyone stayed on the meds and had an ADH recurrence or developed BC Dx 12/3/2018, LCIS/DCIS, Right, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Surgery Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
